\f0\i\fs24 \cf0 \ul \ulc0 Update the java version on linux servers:\

\f1\i0 \ulnone \
\pard\pardeftab720\partightenfactor0

\f2\b \cf2 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0
Upgrading from current_version -> new_version \

\f3\b0 \
cd /usr/lib/jvm \
\

\f2\b #Get the new version s3 bucket\

\f3\b0 s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/jre-8u<version>-linux-x64.tar.gz \
s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/jdk-8u<version>-linux-x64.tar.gz \
tar -xzf jdk-8u<version>-linux-x64.tar.gz \
tar -xzf jre-8u<version>-linux-x64.tar.gz \
\

\f2\b #Delete the old are and jdk version\

\f3\b0 rm -rf /usrlib/jvm/jre1<version> \
rm -rf /usrlib/jvm/jdk1<version>\
\

\f2\b #Remove if there\

\f3\b0 rm /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre\
\

\f2\b #Create soft link \

\f3\b0 ln -s /usr/lib/jvm/jre1<version> /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre \
\

\f2\b #Change ownership of latest version\

\f3\b0 chown root: /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1<version>/ -R \
chown root: /usr/lib/jvm/jre1<version>/ -R \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/ \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/ \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/jre<version> \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version> \
\

\f2\b #Remove old versions from alternatives\

\f3\b0 update-alternatives --remove "java" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/java" \
update-alternatives --remove "javac" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/javac" \
update-alternatives --remove "javaws" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/Java's" \
update-alternatives --remove "jar" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/jar" \
\

\f2\b #Update to new version\

\f3\b0 update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/java java /usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/java 100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/javac javac /usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/javac\'a0\'a0100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/jar jar /usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/jar 100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/javaws javaws /usr/lib/jvm/jdk<version>/bin/javaws 100 \
\

\f4\i\b \ul Live example when moving from 241 -> 251 \

\f3\i0\b0 \ulnone \
Upgrading from 241 -> 251 \
\
cd /usr/lib/jvm \
s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/jre-8u251-linux-x64.tar.gz \
s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/jdk-8u251-linux-x64.tar.gz \
tar -xzf jdk-8u251-linux-x64.tar.gz \
tar -xzf jre-8u251-linux-x64.tar.gz \
\
rm -rf /usrlib/jvm/jre1.8.0_241 \
rm -rf /usrlib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_241 \
\
rm /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre \
ln -s /usr/lib/jvm/jre1.8.0_251 /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre \
chown root: /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251/ -R \
chown root: /usr/lib/jvm/jre1.8.0_251/ -R \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/ \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/ \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/jre1.8.0_251 \
chmod 755 /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251 \
\
update-alternatives --remove "java" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_241/bin/java" \
update-alternatives --remove "javac" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_241/bin/javac" \
update-alternatives --remove "javaws" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_241/bin/Java's" \
update-alternatives --remove "jar" "/usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_241/bin/jar" \
\
\
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/java java /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251/bin/java 100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/javac javac /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251/bin/javac\'a0\'a0100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/jar jar /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251/bin/jar 100 \
update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/javaws javaws /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_251/bin/javaws 100 \
\
\

item.title: upgrading tomcat manual version
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================


Subject: Upgrading tomcat manual version

Revision History:
    2021-07-28 01:37:00 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen



Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Summary: This mostly applies to openam, but could apply to other installations as well.

1) download the desired version of tomcat
2) make a backup of /appdata/tomcat/conf/server.xml
3) unpack the tomcat.tar.z file. This command will unpack to /appdata/tomcat and overwrite only the applicable files and directories:
tar -zxf tomcat.tar.gz -C /appdata/tomcat --strip-components=1
4) change ownership:
chown java-app:java-app /appdata/tomcat -R
5) modify server.xml that you backed up from step 2. It is very likely that the only section you need to update is the one where port 8009 is in use. So go to that section, uncomment it, and make sure it looks like the below:

    <!-- Define an AJP 1.3 Connector on port 8009 -->
    <Connector protocol="AJP/1.3"
               address="0.0.0.0"
               port="8009"
               secretRequired="false"
               redirectPort="8443" />
6) start tomcat and pray everything goes well.

Another vulnerability that resurfaces is "tomcat default files"
To remediate this:
1) remove /appdata/tomcat/docs /appdata/tomcat/examples

Another vulnerability that resurfaces is "tomcat custom error page"

To remediate this, replace the contents of /appdata/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/index.jsp 

with this:
